modules.description: This module provides operations to measure elapsed time in nanoseconds and optionally determine the clock's period. It works with a unit type representing a connected clock device. Concrete use cases include timing intervals for network operations or scheduling tasks in MirageOS applications.

This module provides operations to retrieve high-resolution time values as days and picoseconds since the epoch, with support for time zone offset and clock period queries. It works with a unit type representing a connected clock device and returns time data as integer pairs and optional values. Concrete use cases include precise time measurement for network protocols, timestamping events in distributed systems, and synchronizing operations across virtualized or embedded devices.

This module offers precise time measurement and clock management capabilities for MirageOS applications using Lwt. It provides two main interfaces: one for measuring elapsed time in nanoseconds and determining clock period, and another for retrieving high-resolution timestamps in days and picoseconds since the epoch, with time zone and clock period support. Key operations include timing intervals for network tasks, timestamping events in distributed systems, and synchronizing operations across virtualized or embedded environments.
